definition: mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: He stopped and chuckled as he tugged at his gray goatee .
sentences.chinese: 说到这里他停了下来，捋着山羊胡子格格地笑着。

sentences.english: He has a distinctive goatee, so I can recognize him easily.
sentences.chinese: 他留着独特的山羊胡子，所以我很容易就认出他来了。

sentences.english: It was his goatee that annoyed her the most.
sentences.chinese: 让她感到最讨厌的就是他那把山羊胡子。

sentences.english: Despite his goatee, Mr Mallya deserves a hearing.
sentences.chinese: 不管他的山羊胡子，马尔雅先生需要一场听证会。

sentences.english: Do it for me at once, " said Abraham, stroking the goatee on his chin."
sentences.chinese: 阿伯拉汉边说边摸著下巴的一小撮山羊胡子。

sentences.english: A carefully trimmed goatee can also infuse an element of squareness to a soft chin.
sentences.chinese: 仔细修剪的山羊胡子也能给柔和的下巴增添正方形感。

definition: see 老頭子|老头子[lao3 tou2 zi5]
variant of 絡腮鬍子|络腮胡子[luo4 sai1 hu2 zi5]
beard/mustache or whiskers/facial hair/CL:撮[zuo3],根[gen1]/(coll.) bandit
